@SsnL, I guess pytorch 0.3.1 had this unintended behaviour because there were no scalar tensors.
While you indeed set the behaviour back to how it was, I am not sure this is what we want for PyTorch?
This would mean that wrapping a model in DataParallel is not a transparent behaviour as sharpsy explained.

Anyway, I am not a big contributor, so I'll let you guys figure this one out 😇

body:
@SsnL, I guess pytorch 0.3.1 had this unintended behaviour because there were no scalar tensors.  
While you indeed set the behaviour back to how it was, I am not sure this is what we want for PyTorch?
This would mean that wrapping a model in `DataParallel` is not a transparent behaviour as __sharpsy__ explained.

Anyway, I am not a big contributor, so I'll let you guys figure this one out :innocent:
